articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: Pakistani former Prime Minister Imran Khan's lawyers could not reach him on Sunday after he spent the night in a jail near the capital following his arrest the previous day on a corruption conviction, a spokesperson said.
articles.title: Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan's lawyers cannot reach him in jail, spokesperson says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was quoted as saying on Sunday that he would work to change the committee that selects judges, amid a wave of protests over planned legislation which could see the highest court stripped of many of its powers.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu says he will likely advance legislation to change judges selection committee

articles.author: Anna Wlodarczak-Semczuk
articles.description: Polish pipeline operator PERN said it had halted pumping through a section of the Druzhba pipeline, which connects Russia to Europe, after detecting a leak in central Poland on Saturday, but it expects flows to resume on Tuesday.
articles.title: Poland hopes to fix leak in Russia's Druzhba oil pipeline by Tuesday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli security forces shot dead three Palestinian militants in the occupied West Bank on Sunday, Israeli police said, drawing threats of revenge by Palestinian militant factions.
articles.title: Three Palestinian militants shot dead, say Israeli police

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italy's coastguard said on Sunday it had recovered two bodies and rescued 57 people off the southern island of Lampedusa, amid reports that more than 30 people were missing following two shipwrecks.
articles.title: Two dead, 57 rescued from migrant shipwrecks off Italy's Lampedusa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Record flooding struck Alaska's capital city on Saturday after a glacial dam outburst, destroying at least one structure and prompting city officials to issue evacuation orders for residents on one street.
articles.title: Record flooding along Alaska river near Juneau prompts evacuations

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: A K-pop music concert scheduled for Sunday at a World Scout Jamboree in South Korea was postponed due to heat safety concerns as the host pressed on with the meet despite extreme temperatures that led three national contingents to pull out.
articles.title: Too hot for K-pop as South Korea scrambles to save scout jamboree

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Ukraine said Russia bombed a blood transfusion centre near the front line in a wave of air strikes overnight while Moscow reported that it had shot down a drone heading to the capital on Sunday in the third such attack in a week.
articles.title: Russia launches burst of missile and drone attacks, Ukraine says

articles.author: Susan Heavey, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Donald Trump on Sunday targeted the federal judge assigned to the case charging him with seeking to overturn the 2020 presidential election, as his lawyer argued that actions Trump took after his loss were just "asks."
articles.title: Trump targets DC judge in 2020 election case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Daimler Truck's (DTGGe.DE) Chief Financial Officer Jochen Goetz has died in a "tragic accident," the company said on Sunday.
articles.title: Daimler Truck CFO Jochen Goetz dies in 'tragic accident'
